qas.question: What provoked the modernization and expansion of the Brazilian administrative, civic, economical, military, educational, and scientific apparatus?

answers.text: the change in its status and the arrival of the Portuguese royal family

qas.question: Portugese and British troops fought against the invasion of which country?
By what year had the situation in Europe cool down enough so that Joao VI would have been able to safely return to Lisbon?
Until when did the King of Portugal remain in Brazil?
Where did the Liberal Revolution of 1820 begin?

context: As a result of <a0_0>the change in its status and the arrival of the Portuguese royal family<a0_0/>, Brazilian administrative, civic, economical, military, educational, and scientific apparatus were expanded and highly modernized. Portuguese and their allied British troops fought against the <a1_0>French<a1_0/> Invasion of Portugal and by <a2_0>1815<a2_0/> the situation in Europe had cooled down sufficiently that João VI would have been able to return safely to Lisbon. However, the King of Portugal remained in Brazil <a3_0>until the Liberal Revolution of 1820<a3_0/>, which started in <a4_0>Porto<a4_0/>, demanded his return to Lisbon in 1821.
